intro: Hemianemia ahenobarba, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant has a rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. Its root system is deep, allowing it to access groundwater during dry periods. Hemianemia ahenobarba plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing sandy soils.
